subject: RE: [junit] repeating tests, configuring each iteration
msgSnippet: You could just create a method foo(param) that each test calls with just different paramaters: public void testConfig1() { foo( params for config1 ); } public

You could just create a method foo(param) that each test calls with just
different paramaters:
 
public void testConfig1()
{
    foo( params for config1 );
}
 
public void testConfig2()
{
    foo( params for config 2 );
}
 
private void foo( params )
{
    //your code with the asserts
}
 
I have found it useful to keep seperate configurations in seperate tests.
 
Hope it helps,
Nathan
 
 
-----Original Message-----
From: Joshua Fox [mailto:list@...]
Sent: Monday, December 02, 2002 12:33 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] repeating tests, configuring each iteration



I'd like to run the same test , testFoo() in class BarTest, many times, 
each time passing in a somewhat different configuration. In the excellent 
add-on JUnit++, I see a ConfigurableTestCase that allows me to set a 
configuration once for each test case, and a RepeatableTestCase that lets 
me repeat a test, but how do I repeat tests, changing the configuration 
each time? This seems so natural that someone must have written it, but I 
have not seen it in JUnit, JUnit++, or JFunc.

Suggestions?

Thanks,

Joshua Fox
